title: What to know about Damon Jones, the man at the center of two NBA scandals
content: After making more than $21 million across 11 seasons in the NBA, the NBA journeyman fell hard -- and, prosecutors allege, into a life of crime.

title: Sources: Bucs get good news on Mayfield's MRI
content: The MRI for Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield revealed a low-grade AC joint sprain in his left shoulder but showed no additional damage, sources told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler on Monday.

title: Gabriel cleared but Sanders to stay Browns' QB1
content: Shedeur Sanders will start at quarterback in Sunday's game against the 49ers, Browns coach Kevin Stefanski announced Monday.

title: Tucker to get Saints tryout, 1st since suspension
content: The Saints are bringing in former Ravens kicker Justin Tucker for a tryout, coach Kellen Moore confirmed.

title: Chase sorry for spitting: 'What I did was wrong'
content: Bengals wide receiver Ja'Marr Chase apologized Monday for spitting on Steelers defensive back Jalen Ramsey.

title: CFP, ESPN extend deadline for format changes
content: The College Football Playoff and ESPN agreed to extend the deadline to Jan. 23 to determine if there will be any changes made to the format for 2026 and beyond.

title: Minority owners claim Ishbia mismanaging Suns
content: A pair of Phoenix Suns minority owners allege that Mat Ishbia is using the franchise as "his personal piggy bank" in a lawsuit claiming misconduct and mismanagement by the Suns' governor.

title: QB Daniels to practice, long shot to return Sunday
content: Commanders quarterback Jayden Daniels will return to practice this week but is considered a long shot to play versus the Broncos on Sunday night.

title: UGA dismisses OL after police chase tied to mom
content: Georgia has dismissed backup offensive lineman Nyier Daniels a day after his arrest after allegedly driving more than 150 mph while attempting to flee police. Daniels initially sped past police while his mom was pulled over, the police report said.

title: How Christian McCaffrey became a scrimmage yard king on the verge of NFL history
content: McCaffrey, one of the best receiving running backs in NFL history, plays his former team on "Monday Night Football."

title: Dan Morgan's journey from $35M player to $35K scout -- and now Panthers GM
content: Morgan is one of only two general managers -- the other being the 49ers' John Lynch -- who  played in the NFL.

title: Three Week 12 comeback wins and what they mean: Barnwell on the Cowboys, Chiefs, Lions
content: Dallas was down 21. Detroit was down 10. And Kansas City was down 11. What did we learn as all three rallied in the second half to win their games on Sunday?

title: Wetzel: Lane Kiffin has a near $100 million decision coming Saturday. He better win Friday
content: As the drama at Ole Miss drags on, there's a game to play Friday. And the pressure on Kiffin to win will be overwhelming.

title: Surprise signings! Potential busts! We hand out 2025-26 MLB free agent superlatives
content: Surprise signings? Slugger or bust? Most impact? We've got a yearbook's worth of awards for the top MLB free agents.

title: Men's AP Top 25 poll Week 3 reaction: What to know about every team
content: The third in-season men's AP Top 25 poll for 2025-26 is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: Your guide to men's college basketball Feast Week: The 9 best games to watch
content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to a showcase in New York City, here's what we're watching this week.

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: The third in-season women's AP Top 25 poll is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: 'We're working to the end': How interim coaches handle their short time in charge
content: In a wild coaching carousel, this is the season of the interim coach. They talked about how to get through the season.

title: 30 best pro wrestlers under 30: Did 'Dirty Dom' repeat in 2025?
content: Who are the best young stars across professional wrestling? We rank the top 30 wrestlers under age 30.

title: Early NBA contender questions: How top 16 teams can keep playoff hopes alive
content: Our insiders answer one big question on the top NBA teams with title ambitions and explain what they need to do to stay a contender.

title: First-month lessons: What we're hearing on all 30 teams
content: Let's take the pulse of the league on OKC's chase for 70 wins, and more first-month standout storylines.

title: WNBA mock draft: UConn's Fudd is new No. 1 as Wings win lottery
content: Azzi Fudd is the new projected No. 1 pick after Dallas won the draft lottery for the second consecutive year.

title: Did Dallas' win set the table for a playoff run?
content: Dallas overcame a 21-0 deficit to beat its division rivals, but the path to the postseason remains tough.

title: Predicting the USMNT's starting lineup at the World Cup: What previous tournaments tell us
content: When the USMNT plays in a World Cup, there are always some locks, and always some players who come out of nowhere to start games.

title: Ranking Ronaldo's overhead kick goals for Real Madrid, Portugal, Al Nassr
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's 954th career goal was one of his best, adding to his collection of stunning acrobatic strikes. Here they all are -- ranked!

title: Liverpool's crisis deepens with another defeat, and more dropped points for Madrid
content: A bad season just keeps getting worse for Arne Slot and Liverpool, while Real Madrid also dropped points in a sluggish draw with Elche. Ga Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: NFL Week 13 odds: Eagles a TD favorite over Bears, Colts have edge vs. Texans
content: It's Thanksgiving week of the NFL season. Here are the odds, spreads and totals for every Week 13 game.

title: Gemini 3.0 launch: Salesforce CEO says won't use ChatGPT again; praises Google’s AI model
content: Salesforce CEO Mark Benioff has declared his switch from ChatGPT to Google's Gemini 3.0. He experienced a significant shift after using Google's latest AI model. Benioff highlighted Gemini 3's improvements in reasoning, speed, image, and video processing. This move signals intense competition in the AI landscape, with other tech leaders acknowledging Gemini 3's success.

title: OpenAI's internal memo: Altman notes Google’s AI success; calls it 'temporary headwind'
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledges Google's AI advancements, noting potential "temporary economic headwinds" but expressing confidence in OpenAI's rapid progress and leadership in the AI race. Despite concerns about slowing ChatGPT engagement, Altman urged employees to focus on achieving superintelligence, highlighting the company's strength and unique challenges.

title: Apple's warning to stores: Foreign SIM = penalty; outlets face closure risk
content: Apple distributors are warning Indian retailers against activating new iPhones, especially the iPhone 17 series, with foreign SIMs within 90 days, citing hefty penalties and store code blocking. This crackdown follows a surge in iPhone 17 models being diverted to high-margin markets like Russia, Africa, and the Middle East, causing domestic shortages. Retailers are pushing back against this mandate, arguing it unfairly targets them.

title: Is Erika Kirk pregnant? Megyn Kelly reacts to her prayer after Charlie’s death
content: Erika Kirk, widow of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, revealed her profound grief and hope during a talk with Megyn Kelly. She shared her prayer of being pregnant at the time of Charlie's tragic death, desiring a larger family. Erika also urged young women to prioritize starting families, emphasizing that careers can wait, but motherhood cannot be indefinitely postponed.

title: Stefon Diggs’ partner Cardi B makes gold pendant from baby’s umbilical cord
content: Cardi B commemorated her fourth child's birth by transforming her umbilical cord into a gold pendant and her placenta into vitamins. This unique practice, offered by Mommy Made Encapsulation, also includes creating a "Tree of Life" placenta print. The service aims to preserve the initial bond between parent and child, a trend embraced by other celebrities.

title: Tom Brady’s on-air slip? Viral Cowboys-Eagles clip triggers debate online
content: Tom Brady stumbled over a player's name during a live broadcast of the Dallas Cowboys versus Philadelphia Eagles game. The incident occurred in the final minutes of the match. Social media users reacted to the verbal mix-up. Brady is in his second season as a commentator for FOX. The game itself saw Dallas achieve a historic comeback victory.

title: Is Drake London playing Week 13 vs Jets? Latest injury update on Falcons WR
content: Atlanta Falcons wide receiver Drake London suffered a PCL sprain on November 17, 2025, and is considered week-to-week. While a return for Week 13 is uncertain, the team is prioritizing his health, especially after losing quarterback Michael Penix Jr. for the season. London's availability will depend on his recovery and the team's playoff standing.

title: Taylor Swift pulled into Blake Lively’s legal drama with Justin Baldoni
content: Blake Lively has reportedly involved Taylor Swift as a potential witness in her legal dispute with Justin Baldoni, despite Swift's team denying involvement. This has strained their friendship, with Lively fearing career repercussions due to Swift's influence. Meanwhile, Swift is reportedly facing security concerns as she plans her wedding to Travis Kelce.

title: 'Masks off, real faces out': BJP flays Congress; Hidma posters at pollution protest stir sparks row
content: BJP leader Sudhanshu Trivedi criticized protesters at India Gate for raising slogans supporting a slain Naxal commander, accusing them of being influenced by "pollution of Marx and Mao." The protest, initially against air pollution, saw demonstrators holding posters of Madvi Hidma, leading to arrests by Delhi Police for obstructing personnel and assaulting them.

title: This blood type may raise the risk of fatal liver disease, new study finds
content: New research links blood type A to a higher risk of autoimmune liver diseases. Individuals with blood type B may face a lower risk, particularly for primary biliary cholangitis. Autoimmune liver disease occurs when the body's immune system attacks the liver. While blood type is a factor, lifestyle choices and regular check-ups remain crucial for liver health.

title: 'What to tell my parents': Savannah James recalls fear of getting pregnant at 16
content: Savannah James candidly shared her teenage fears upon discovering her pregnancy at 16, worrying about her parents and LeBron's burgeoning career. Despite her anxieties, LeBron's unwavering confidence and commitment reassured her. Their bond proved strong, leading to a successful NBA career for LeBron and a lasting marriage with three children, defying early challenges.

title: BLO deaths: EC moves fast after audio surfaces of official; TMC sharpens attack
content: The Election Commission is addressing work-related stress among Booth Level Officers (BLOs) during Kerala's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls after an audio message went viral. This follows reports of BLO suicides and deaths due to excessive pressure in several states, prompting protests and criticism from political parties regarding the rushed and opaque nature of the revision process.

title: Ethiopia volcano ash plumes: DGCA issues advisory; asks airlines to avoid affected region
content: India's aviation regulator has advised airlines to avoid flight paths and altitudes affected by volcanic ash from Ethiopia's Hayli Gubbi eruption. Airports are inspecting runways for contamination, with flight disruptions anticipated as ash plumes move eastward towards Delhi and Jaipur.

title: Will Campbell playing against Giants? Coach Mike Vrabel shares injury details
content: New England Patriots' starting left tackle Will Campbell suffered a concerning knee injury during Sunday's win over the Bengals. Coach Mike Vrabel indicated Campbell might miss significant time, potentially impacting the team's strong offensive line. The Patriots, already dealing with another lineman's ankle issue, face uncertainty as they prepare for Monday night's game against the Giants.

title: 3 night time drinks that can help reduce high blood pressure in the morning
content: The minerals, calcium, potassium and magnesium present in milk help blood vessels relax, while maintaining proper fluid equilibrium. The cardiovascular system experiences reduced pressure because of these effects, which also enhance artery flexibility

title: 'Not easy task': Bengal CEO lauds BLOs amid SIR; seeks reports on 'work-pressure deaths'
content: Booth Level Officers in Kolkata protested against work-related stress during the special intensive revision of electoral rolls. The Chief Election Officer stated that District Magistrates have been asked to assist BLOs and investigate the deaths of four BLOs during the exercise. The protest highlights concerns over immense work pressure and its impact on BLOs' health.

title: 'Sensitive time': Groom's sister Palak Muchhal breaks silence
content: Smriti Mandhana's wedding to Palash Muchhal has been indefinitely postponed due to her father's sudden hospitalisation.  Palak Muchhal confirmed the sensitive situation, requesting privacy.  Both Smriti's father and fiancé were hospitalised, though Palash has since been discharged.  The family is focused on Mr Mandhana's recovery, with his condition stable but requiring observation.

title: Difference between tea bags and loose tea leaves, guide and brewing
content: Tea bags offer quick, consistent brews with smaller leaf particles, ideal for busy mornings. Loose-leaf tea, featuring whole leaves, provides richer, more nuanced flavours and aromas, making it a treat for slower moments. While tea bags are convenient and cost-effective, loose-leaf tea often boasts superior quality, environmental benefits, and a more engaging brewing ritual for discerning drinkers.

title: ISRO chief explains why students need more than just marks
content: ISRO chief V Narayanan has warned that India cannot afford to produce “mere bookworms”, backing value-based education and social–emotional learning over a marks-only culture. Linking his views with NEP 2020, OECD and WEF data, we argue that traits like self-control, respect, empathy and resilience shape employability, well-being and citizenship far more deeply than exam scores alone for today’s students.

title: ‘Victory will inspire’: PM Modi congratulates women’s kabaddi team; India wins World Cup
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the Indian women's kabaddi team for winning the Kabaddi World Cup 2025. India defeated Chinese Taipei 35-28 in the final, marking their second consecutive World Cup title and remaining undefeated throughout the tournament. The victory is expected to inspire young athletes.

title: Devils vs Red Wings: NHL preview, how to watch, timings, venue & prediction
content: The New Jersey Devils will host the Detroit Red Wings on November 24, 2025, at the Prudential Center. Despite injuries, the Devils are favored at -142, boasting a strong penalty kill and power play. Detroit, however, has a strong underdog record, making this an intriguing matchup with an expected high-scoring game.

title: Crash course! Crypto markets $1tn rout hits Trump family; what's extent of loss
content: The Trump family is facing financial setbacks from the recent plummet in the cryptocurrency market, particularly hit hard by a drop in their memecoin investments, Bitcoin mining operations, and crypto assets tied to their social media ventures. Nevertheless, Eric Trump maintains a positive outlook on the future of cryptocurrencies, perceiving these market dips as prime opportunities for investment.

title: Xi, Trump hold phone call; discuss US-China bilateral cooperation, Taiwan
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping and US President Donald Trump held a phone call to discuss bilateral cooperation and Taiwan. Xi emphasized maintaining momentum in ties after their recent meeting and reiterated that Taiwan's return to China is a key aspect of the post-war international order.

title: Explained: Why your nose is bleeding when you sneeze, causes and prevention
content: Experiencing blood streaks after a sneeze can be alarming, but it's often due to common issues like dry air, allergies, or forceful sneezes irritating delicate nasal vessels. Understanding these triggers, from environmental factors to underlying health conditions, is key to effective treatment and prevention. Simple remedies and lifestyle adjustments can significantly reduce future occurrences.

title: Pakistan overturns life ban on Arshad Nadeem's coach; terms action 'unconstitutional'
content: An adjudicator has overturned the life ban on Salman Butt, coach to Pakistan's javelin thrower Arshad Nadeem. Senator Pervez Rashid deemed the Pakistan Amateur Athletics Federation's action unconstitutional, citing a lack of due process. Butt is now free to continue coaching Nadeem and represent Pakistan internationally.

title: New TB vaccine for adolescents, adults ready for commercialisation
content: Developed jointly by Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Bhubaneswar and the Institute of Life Sciences (ILS), Bhubaneswar, the vaccine will help combat mycobacterium tuberculosis

title: West Bengal CEO meets telecom service providers over internet connectivity issues among BLOs
content: This comes in the wake of a section of BLOs raising concerns around the unavailability of high-speed internet necessary for the digitisation process of enumeration forms

title: Congress alleges deletion of voters’ names during SIR in Rajasthan
content: Pradesh Congress Committee president Govind Singh Dotasra said the voters with Congress ideology were being removed from electoral rolls on the pretext of their absence

title: Bengal Governor visits Swarupnagar to take stock of ‘reverse migration’ due to SIR fears
content: Governor C. V Ananda Bose said that there are reports of exodus of people from the India- Bangladesh border and there are several interpretations of that

title: MBBS list row: Admissions should be based on merit, not religion, says J&K CM
content: CM Omar Abdullah stated that the narrative being floated around admissions at the Mata Vaishno Devi University was an attempt to “move away from constitutional principles”

title: BJP flags ‘threats’ to officials conducting SIR in West Bengal, Jharkhand
content: BJP MP Sudhanshu Trivedi stated that Jharkhand Minister allegedly said that any booth-level officer of the Election Commission who comes to gather information from people “should be taken hostage”

title: ISRO offers satellite support to Railways to boost communication systems
content: We will be tripling our number of satellites, including three more navigation and communication satellites, adding to the existing four, says ISRO chairman

title: Gujarat police complete verification of 31,834 people booked for ‘anti-national’ activities
content: In the verification that followed, 11,880 were found to be living at the addresses listed in the case files, while 2,326 had died

title: Amid concerns over ongoing SIR in West Bengal, some Matuas go on fast, others seek citizenship under CAA
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee will visit Thakurnagar, the spiritual headquarters of the Matua community in Bongaon subdivision of North 24 Parganas district bordering Bangladesh, on Tuesday and take out a 3-km roadshow

title: Chhattisgarh school girl ends her life after accusing principal of sexual harassment
content: She has left a note in which she has mentioned the term “bad touch” and that she was sexually assaulted by the school principal nearly a week ago, say police

title: Chhattisgarh government tasks school principals to monitor stray dogs in and around premises
content: Slamming the move, Congress spokesperson Sushil Anand Shukla asked why teachers were being assigned duties meant for municipal experts

title: Karnataka moves to expand disability rights with new job and education quotas in private sector
content: A draft of the Karnataka Rights of Persons with Disabilities in Employment and Education Bill, 2025, proposing 5% reservation for persons with disabilities in all private establishments with 20 or more employees, has been released

title: One year on, Sambhal stays peaceful amid tight security
content: Police teams, 19 Magistrates, units of the Rapid Action Force and two battalions of the Provincial Armed Constabulary were deployed in the district to maintain order, said a senior officer

title: Unable to implement CAA, BJP is creating national register of citizens through SIR: Thirumavalavan
content: According to Mr. Thirumavalavan BJP is unable to make inroads into Tamil Nadu because of DMK, VCK, and Communists.

title: Inter-State racket in fake GST invoicing busted in Chennai
content: GST Commissioner (North) said the prime suspect who was operating an unregistered tax consultancy firm, M/s A.S. Associates, in Chennai, was arrested.

title: Goa government does a U-turn on tiger presence in State
content: The State, which claimed in 2018 that there is no “permanent presence” of tigers, has stated the opposite in the Mahadayi sharing dispute issue before Supreme Court

title: Woman from Arunachal Pradesh stopped at China airport; India issues strong demarche
content: Prema Thongdok said immigration and airlines staff were “unprofessional and rude”, they laughed and mocked calling Arunachal Pradesh a Chinese territory

title: SBI Ventures plans to launch ₹2,000-crore climate-focussed fund in Jan-Mar
content: It will help unlock green growth, a new financial opportunity, SBI Ventures Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer Prem Prabhakar said

title: ‘Sankranti Sambaralu’ to be organised in NTR District during harvest festival
content: Andhra Taxi App to be launched, temples, tourist spots to be developed for the festival, says Collector

title: Supreme Court notice to government on plea to frame national compensation policy for unjust imprisonment
content: Petition seeks to recommend appropriate yardsticks for monetary and non-monetary relief, including counselling, livelihood assistance, and social reintegration

title: Boys' 2026 recruiting class rankings: Michigan State up, Houston in, Duke far from finished
content: Missouri remains No. 1, with Michigan State at No. 2, Duke No. 3 and new adds Houston, Purdue, West Virginia.

title: Pickups: Time to add Collin Gillespie, Derik Queen, Jusuf Nurkic
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Weekly waiver pickups: Add these defensemen for assists, power-play points
content: The essential Monday guide to fantasy hockey pickups, with who to add and how to get set for the week ahead.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Vinícius tells Real Madrid he won't renew contract
content: Vinícius Júnior has expressed his unwillingness to renew his contract with Real Madrid. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Not just play: Why Physical Education may be the smartest learning hour in school
content: A new meta-analysis finds that turning school Physical Education from lonely laps into structured, team-based activities can sharply improve children’s thinking skills, social confidence, physical competence and emotional resilience. With shared goals, clear roles and quick reflection built into games, the PE period becomes a powerful lab for better classroom learning, focus and engagement for children in today’s schools everywhere.

title: From Gaza to USA: How Twitter trolls were manufacturing consent and dissent
content: The chaos began with a small icon Musk probably assumed would be a cute transparency feature. Instead, it detonated the timeline. For years, people fought with strangers online under the illusion that these strangers lived nearby. That illusion collapsed the moment the map pin dropped. Suddenly, timelines were littered with patriots tweeting from Ankara, Gaza reporters posting from Krakow, and Ivanka Trump megafans tapping away from a quiet suburb in Lagos.

title: 'Why? Why? Why?': Angry Mamata shoots off letter to EC; flags 'disturbing' decisions
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has expressed alarm to the Election Commission over two "disturbing" developments concerning the state's election machinery. She questioned the outsourcing of data entry work by the Chief Electoral Officer and the proposal to set up polling booths in private housing complexes, citing concerns about fairness and potential political influence.

title: Modi to visit Ayodhya, hoist sacred flag at Ram Temple
content: The Dhwaja Rohan (flag-hoisting) ceremony signifies the completion of the Ram Temple’s construction; The event is taking place on the auspicious day of Vivaah Panchami.

title: West Bengal CM writes to CEC asking whether initiatives taken are at the behest of a political party
content: This is the second letter addressed by the Trinamool Congress chairperson to CEC; in her letter dated November 20, Ms. Banerjee had urged CEC Gyanesh Kumar to halt the SIR pointing out that the human cost of the management of the exercise has turned unbearable

title: Protests in M.P.’s Raisen over rape of 6-year-old girl; accused remains absconding
content: The girl was taken to a government hospital in neighbouring Obaidullaganj but was immediately referred to AIIMS, Bhopal where she is undergoing treatment

title: Navy gets its ‘silent hunter’, 80% home-grown INS Mahe
content: Army chief General Dwivedi launches warship, says in age of ‘multi-domain’ warfare, ‘true strength’ of the armed forces lies in ‘synergy’, adds that Army, Navy and Air Force form “the trinity of India’s strategic strength”

title: Maoists offer to surrender by February 15 in letter to three CMs
content: Special zonal committee of the banned Communist Party of India (Maoist) asks Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh to pause security operations as it considers the government’s rehabilitation programme

title: Press Club concerned over some clauses of Data Protection Act
content: They flagged serious lacunae in the DPDP Act, 2023, that impinge upon press freedom and directly hit Article 19 (1)

title: BEL, Safran sign JV to manufacture precision-guided weapon
content: The agreement was signed in New Delhi by BEL CMD Manoj Jain and SED Executive Vice President Alexandre Ziegler. Secretary (Defence Production) Sanjeev Kumar and Safran CEO Olivier Andries were present for the ceremony

title: HC sets aside order resuming nine acres land allotted to AAI
content: The order seeking resumption of the nine acres of land at Kancha Gachhibowli was ‘bereft of reasons’ and lacked jurisdiction

title: Elephant safaris resume in Corbett and Rajaji reserves after 7 years
content: Elephant safaris have been resumed in the Dhikala and Jhirna ranges of the Corbett Tiger Reserve (CTR) and the Cheela range of the Rajaji Tiger Reserve (RTR) during the current tourist season

title: Japanese delegation visits ISRO to review Chandrayaan-5/ LuPEX mission
content: The Chandrayaan-5 LuPEX mission is the fifth mission in the Chandrayaan series of lunar missions to study the lunar volatile materials, including lunar water, in the vicinity of a Permanently Shadowed Region in the lunar South pole

title: Cab drivers protest outside Uber centre in Bengaluru accusing the company of unfair practices
content: The protest, organised by members of the Bharath Transportation Group, alleged  that Uber is favouring fleet-attached vehicles over independent drivers

title: Genome Valley gets bioprocess design, scale-up facility
content: Minister Sridhar Babu, who opened the facility, said TGIIC is to undertake ₹200 crore infrastructure upgrades as the famous Life Sciences cluster of Hyderabad commemorates 25 years

title: Leadership issue: All eyes on Rahul Gandhi
content: Party sources say that Kharge is likely to brief Rahul Gandhi in a couple of days following which both Siddaramaiah and Shivakumar are likely to be called for consultation

title: Anaemia, malnutrition still rampant in Telangana’s Koya and Gond tribal communities
content: Recent ‘One Health’ outreach held in Bhadradri Kothagudem brings renewed attention to long-standing health inequities in some of the most remote forested regions in the State

title: ED raids three online gaming companies; freezes accounts with over ₹523 crore
content: The ED says it has found that WinZO continued operating real-money games in foreign markets such as the U.S., Brazil, and Germany, using the same platform as India- even after the nationwide ban on RMGs took effect on August 22, 2025

title: BWSSB opens wastewater treatment plants to start-ups to boost home-grown water innovation
content: BWSSB Chairman Ram Prasath Manohar says the move signals a new chapter in Bengaluru’s efforts to solve its water challenges using solutions emerging from within the city’s own ecosystem.

title: Delhi government, private offices to enforce 50% work from home due to high pollution
content: All private offices functioning within Delhi will operate with not more than 50% staff physically attending the workplace, while the remaining staff will “mandatorily” work from home

title: Newly formed Stadium division set to witness a high-profile contest
content: For UDF candidate Deepthi Mary Varghese, whose name is doing the rounds as a potential mayoral candidate, and LDF-backed Independent George Nanatt, Stadium, formed after delimitation, is a mix of their sitting divisions;  BDJS has fielded J. Asokan as NDA candidate

title: Maize growers stage protests in Kittur Karnataka
content: Farmers’ protest in districts of Kittur Karnataka have intensified. They are demanding an MSP of ₹3,000 a quintal. On Monday, several seers joined the protest in Haveri to express solidarity with the farmers

title: A.P. Government forms high-level panel of ten global experts to steer ‘Healthy Andhra Pradesh’ vision
content: Chief Minister clears an international advisory group tasked with shaping a comprehensive plan to strengthen public health systems and fast-track the State’s move towards becoming a model for health-centred governance

title: At ₹137.25 crore per acre, Neopolis shatters own record in HMDA e-auction
content: In August 2023, Neopolis plots fetched a record ₹100.75 crore per acre, but on Monday two marquee parcels in the same layout drew even higher bids, topping out at ₹137.25 crore per acre

title: 25 events to mark Veerendra Heggade’s birthday today
content: As many as 25 educational institutions in Hubballi-Dharwad will host the events to mark the Dharmadhikari’s 78th birthday celebrations

title: Goa tops in digitisation of SIR forms, Kerala lags
content: Election Commission says enumeration forms of 99.07% voters have been collected and over 47% of them digitised; BLOs race against time to finish exercise, many complain of ‘excess workload’

title: Trump Administration Orders Review Of Biden-Era Refugees, Memo Shows
content: US President Donald Trump's administration has ordered a broad vetting review of all refugees who entered under former President Joe Biden, an internal US government memo seen by Reuters said.

title: Trump Begins Process Of Labeling Muslim Brotherhood Chapters As Terrorist
content: President Donald Trump on Monday signed an executive order directing his administration to determine whether to designate certain chapters of the Muslim Brotherhood, such as those in Lebanon, Egypt, and Jordan.

title: India, Afghanistan Commit To Enhancing Trade, Economic Cooperation
content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Monday met with Alhaj Nooruddin Azizi, Afghanistan's Minister of Industry and Commerce, to discuss advancing economic cooperation and expanding bilateral trade between the two nations.

title: Sudan's Top General Rejects US-led Ceasefire Plan, Rebel Group Agrees
content: Sudan's top general rejected a ceasefire proposal provided by US-led mediators in a blow to efforts to stop a devastating war that has gripped the African country for over 30 months.

title: Officials Say Progress Made On Amending US Peace Plan For Ukraine
content: Officials on Monday said progress was made in urgent weekend talks on amending the US peace proposal for Ukraine that many saw as favoring Russia, but the Kremlin said it hadn't seen the changes.

title: Meerut 'Blue Drum' Murder Accused Muskan Gives Birth To Baby Girl
content: Muskan, who is in Meerut jail for the gruesome murder of her husband Saurabh Rajput and hiding his body in a blue drum, gave birth to a baby girl at the local medical college hospital on Monday evening, jail officials said.

title: PM Modi vs Mamata Banerjee: BJP's Kaleidoscopic Strategy In The Bengal Battlefield
content: As the sun sets on the electoral battle in Bihar, the BJP - which appears to have perfected the art of anticipation - has started laying the groundwork for its next big performance: the West Bengal assembly elections of 2026.

title: Chinese Citizen, 49, Arrested In UP For Illegally Entering India
content: A 49-year-old Chinese citizen was arrested by the Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) at the Rupaidiha checkpost on the India-Nepal border in the Bahraich district of Uttar Pradesh on Monday after he illegally entered India.

title: Several Flights Cancelled As Ethiopian Volcanic Ash Drifts Towards India
content: Several flights were cancelled, and Indian airlines and airports were issued an advisory to deal with possible disruptions due to an ash plume from the volcanic activity in Ethiopia on Monday. The ash cloud is now moving over northern India.

title: Girl, 15, Hangs Self In School, Suicide Note Alleges Harassment By Principal
content: A 15-year-old girl allegedly committed suicide by hanging herself in the study room of a private school after accusing the principal of molesting and sexually harassing her in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur district, officials said on Monday.

title: Madhya Pradesh Farmers Hold 'Funeral' For Onions As Prices Crash
content: Farmers in Dhamnar village of Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur district took out a funeral procession for onions after market prices crashed so low that they could not even recover their basic production and transportation costs

title: "Racist": Australian Politician Slammed For Wearing Burqa In Parliament
content: A far-right Australian politician sparked outrage Monday after donning a burqa at the country's parliament, in a display that other lawmakers slammed as "racist".

title: Probe Agency Hands Over 4 Mumbai Flats Linked To Mehul Choksi For Monetisation
content: The ED has handed over four residential flats in Mumbaiattached in the case involving fugitive businessman Mehul Choksito the liquidator for monetisation, officials said on Monday.

title: Mumbai International Airport Surpasses Previous High For Single-Day Movements
content: Adani Group-AAI-run Mumbai International Airport handled 1,036 air traffic movements in a single day on November 21, surpassing its earlier best of 1,032 achieved earlier this month, mainly due to festive demand.

title: 3 Arrested For Posing As Police Officers To Impress Relatives At Wedding
content: Three people were allegedly arrested in Jhalawar, Rajasthan, for allegedly posing as policemen to impress family members at a wedding, officials said on Monday.

title: 4 UK Cops Face Misconduct Charges In Harshita Brella Murder Case
content: Four police officers in the UK have been accused of misconduct on Monday over their handling of abuse allegations reported by Harshita Brella, the Delhi woman later found dead in a car boot with her husband Pankaj Lamba on the run as the main suspect

title: Delhi Boy Loses Ear In Shocking Pit Bull Attack, Dog Owner Arrested
content: A six-year-old boy was left with severe injuries, including the loss of his right ear, after a pit bull mauled him in northwest Delhi's Prem Nagar area.

title: Cab Driver Trying To Break Up Fight Stabbed To Death In Faridabad
content: A 40-year-old man was stabbed to death when he tried to break up a fight near Sector 17 bypass road here, police said on Monday.

title: Saudi Arabia Residents Report Alcohol Ban Eased For Select Foreigners
content: Diplomats and premium visa-holders in Saudi Arabia told AFP that the conservative kingdom has quietly eased restrictions on purchasing alcohol for select foreign residents.

title: Rs 25 Lakh Compensation Paid To 95% Of Air India Plane Crash Victims' Families
content: Air India chief Campbell Wilson on Monday said interim compensation has been given to 95 per cent of the families that were affected by the plane crash in June this year.

title: India-EU summit: FTA, defence & connectivity among key outcomes
content: both sides have not allowed the lack of a geopolitical alignment to come in the way of trade negotiations in a sign of the political will at the highest level to carry the relationship to the next level . a dozen chapters are yet to be closed, but EU and india are confident they will be able to reach a deal in time for the summit that is tentatively scheduled for January 27 .

title: Remembering Dharmendra: When 'He-Man' bonded with PM Modi over paratha
content: 'paratha' was a staple diet in the northern state . he said he had grown used to eating paratha in Punjab . the actor praised the PM's mother, who taught him to love him .

title: NFL futures: Rams leapfrog Eagles for Super Bowl favorite status
content: the Los Angeles Rams (+450), the only two-loss team in the NFL, are your new Super Bowl favorites . the Philadelphia Eagles had been the favorites entering Week 12, but saw their odds drop from +500 to +600 after allowing the Dallas Cowboys to come back from down 21-0 .

title: Dharmendra passes away: Garam Dharam leaves behind 'Yaadon Ki Baaraat'
content: Dharmendra passed away at the age of 89 Avijit Ghosh is an associate editor with The Times of India. He is addicted to films, music, cricket and football—and not necessarily in that order. He is the author of Bandicoots in the Moonlight, Cinema Bhojpuri, 40 Retakes, and now, Up Campus, Down Campus, a novel set in 1980s JNU. He tweets from the handle @cinemawaleghosh Read More

title: Student suicides: Parliamentary panel to review spread of coaching centres
content: Representative image Manash Pratim Gohain is a seasoned journalist with over two decades at The Times of India, where he has built a rich body of work spanning education policy, politics, and governance. Renowned for his incisive coverage of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, accreditation reforms, and skilling initiatives, he has also reported on student politics, urban policy, and social movements. His political reportage—both reflective and news-driven—adds depth to his writing, bridging policy with public impact. Through his 2,500 articles and related outlets, he has emerged as a trusted voice in national discourse, particularly in linking education reform to broader societal change. Read More

title: 'No one arrives in SC by accident': Justice Surya Kant after taking oath as CJI
content: President Murmu administers the oath of office to Justice Surya Kant at Rashtrapati Bhavan on Monday

title: Online pharmacy fined Rs 2 lakh for unfair trade practice

title: Sandesaras to pay Rs 5.1 k crore, SC drops bank fraud case
content: fugitive brothers - Nitin and Chetan of Sterling Biotech Ltd - and their associates have till Dec 17 to deposit the amount . the brothers agreed to pay Rs 5,100 crore as one-time settlement to put quietus on the litigations with respect to cases by CBI, ED, SFIO .

title: 'You're from China': New Delhi protests as Beijing trashes Arunachali's passport
content: Manash Pratim Gohain is a seasoned journalist with over two decades at The Times of India, where he has built a rich body of work spanning education policy, politics, and governance. Renowned for his incisive coverage of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, accreditation reforms, and skilling initiatives, he has also reported on student politics, urban policy, and social movements. His political reportage—both reflective and news-driven—adds depth to his writing, bridging policy with public impact. Through his 2,500 articles and related outlets, he has emerged as a trusted voice in national discourse, particularly in linking education reform to broader societal change. Read More

title: SC to hear plea to end income tax exemption for political parties
content: the court agreed to hear a plea to do away with the exemption granted to political parties under income tax law . the court challenged the validity of a provision of the Income Tax Act that allows political parties to receive cash donations below Rs 2,000 . a bench of justices issued notice to all recognised political parties .

title: The best players and biggest moments of 2025
content: the 2025 professional tennis season has come to a close, and what a year it was . a number of surprise victors and compelling storylines combined to make one very memorable season . ESPN's Chris Evert, Sam Querrey and Pam Shriver voted on who should be named the ATP and WTA Players of the Year .

title: Indian flag desecrated & ‘kill’ chants at unofficial ‘Khalistan referendum’ in Ottawa
content: more than 53,000 Canadian Sikhs from Ontario, Alberta, British Columbia, and Quebec queued for two km to cast their ballots . the non-binding referendum asked them to vote on whether they wanted a separate homeland called “Khalistan” and for Punjab to secede from India . sikhs for justice (SFJ) is banned in India under UAPA for its subversive activities .

title: PM Modi to hoist Ram temple flag to mark its completion today
content: Ayodhya temple is decked up on the eve of the flag-hoisting event A member of the TOI UP bureau team, Shalabh brings extensive field reporting experience. While covering various government departments, he focuses on issues with the potential to significantly impact the public, both positively and negatively. Read More

title: Air India plane forgotten at Kolkata airport for 13 yrs, out on 1,900km journey
content: Subhro Niyogi is a Senior Assistant Editor at The Times of India, and his job responsibilities include reporting, editing and coordination of news and news features. His hobbies include photography, driving and reading. Read More

title: France's 'Hammer' arms to be manufactured in India
content: the 'Hammer' smart precision guided air-to-ground weapons were used in the cross-border hostilities with Pakistan under Operation Sindoor in may . the weapons are designed to destroy bunkers and hardened shelters at ranges of around 70 km . indigenous Tejas jets are now being equipped with the weapons .

title: 'EWS' candidates take PG med courses with Rs 1 crore fees
content: representative image Almost 140 candidates have chosen postgraduate seats from management and NRI quotas of private medical colleges . tuition fees alone range from Rs 25 lakh to Rs 1 crore plus per year . this has raised questions about the credibility of EWS certificates .

title: Need to strengthen free speech: CJI Surya Kant
content: justice Surya Kant takes oath as the 53rd CJI . his predecessor, ex-CJI B R Gavai, shared the view . he says freedom of speech "is doubtless one of our most valued rights"

title: Liverpool on course to be worst-ever Premier League champions. Can Slot stop the rot?
content: arne slot's side are on course to be the premier league's worst-ever defending champions . the 47-year-old is floundering, so much so that his team is threatening to make history for the wrong reasons . liverpool spent £450 million on new signings this summer to cement their position as England's dominant force .

title: Winners and losers: Gibbs notches highest score of season, Taylor goes quiet
content: RB Jahmyr Gibbs rushed for 145 more yards than expected and had 15.5 rushing estimated points added . he now has three games with at least 36 fantasy points . his worst game of the season was against the new york Giants .

title: Projecting the College Football Playoff top 12 after Week 13
content: the Sooners beat the Tigers 17-6 in Norman . there wasn't any movement in this week's top 12 projection . a dominant win against a now sub.-500 team isn't going to change the way the committee views Ohio State as the most complete team in the country .

title: The main thing to know from every Week 12 game: Rams sit atop NFC after Eagles' meltdown
content: the Cowboys beat the Eagles in overtime overtime . quarterback shedeur Sanders beat the Raiders in his first start . it was the first time a Browns quarterback won their first start since Eric Zeier in 1995 . the Falcons also bounced back, defying the defense's offense .

title: Takeaways: Kiffin and the CFP, Notre Dame's style points and more
content: our college football experts break down key storylines and takeaways from Week 13 . did it clarify any of the Power 4 conference races? not really. Did it help solidify any part of the College Football Playoff field . the Ducks, ranked no. 7 in the CFP rankings, still hold an outside shot at returning to the Big Ten title game .

title: Let's overreact to Week 12: Is the J.J. McCarthy era already coming to an end?
content: the Minnesota Vikings are a good organization, and they made the decision to go all-in on quarterback J.J. McCarthy and ... well... it just has to get better one of these weeks, right? not this week . the Vikings have offensive line issues .

title: Phoenix Mercury update logo and uniforms in image rebrand
content: the Phoenix Mercury rolled out a rebranded image with new uniforms and logos . the new logo and uniforms were revealed during a private event in Phoenix on friday . a goal was to modernize a logo that the organization believed was true to the 1990s, he says .

title: Free agent pickups: The players you need for a playoff push
content: the 12th Sunday of the season featured a historic outing by a Detroit Lions RB Jahmyr Gibbs and a notable comeback victories by the desperate Kansas City Chiefs and Dallas Cowboys . four teams served their bye this week, but none do this coming Thanksgiving week, which features a trio of games on Thursday .

title: NHL's best this week: The case for a new 'playoff cutoff' date
content: 77.1% of NHL teams in a playoff spot on American Thanksgiving made the postseason . this season could be different: in the past 10 seasons, the average gap between top and bottling . if an NHL team is in playoff position by American Thanksgiving, they will probably make the playoffs .

title: Where the most chaos could be lurking on Rivalry Week
content: the penultimate week of the college football regular season gave us plenty of entertainment . we got an incredible comeback in Salt Lake City, we got some resounding blowouts and we got the best ending of the season at the Division II level . the ACC gave us more chaos thanks to Georgia Tech's no-show against Pitt .

title: 📈 CFB Power Rankings: Two new teams join
content: americanC averaged 190.8 rushing yards across its first 10 games this fall . the no. 7 Ducks improved to 10-1 after a 42-27 win over the Trojans . it's a second straight college football playoff appearance in the 2025 season .

title: Offseason grades: Judging the Nimmo-for-Semien swap for Mets, Rangers
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .
